content:
A neutral color palette is a collection of colors that are considered to be neutral or natural in appearance. Examples of neutral colors include white, black, gray, beige, taupe, and navy blue. These colors are considered to be timeless and versatile and can be easily paired with other colors to create a cohesive look. They are considered to be the base colors of a wardrobe, and can be easily dressed up or down depending on the occasion.

Accent colors are colors that are used to add visual interest and contrast to a neutral color palette. They are used to add a pop of color and draw attention to specific areas of an outfit. Examples of accent colors include red, green, yellow, pink, orange, and purple. They are used to complement the neutral colors and make the outfit more dynamic and interesting. They are used to add personality to the outfit and make it more unique.

For example, if your neutral color palette includes white, black, and gray, you could use a red accent color to add a pop of color to your outfit. An outfit consisting of a white button-down shirt, black trousers and a red blazer would look great together and it's a good example of using accent colors to complement neutral colors.
